intro: Dichapetalum steenisii subsp. celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
